snippet: Documents released on Wednesday show that federal investigators have devoted considerable attention on the actions of a driver who was one of six people killed in the February collision.
abstract: National Transportation Safety Board releases documents related to continuing investigation of February 3 fatal crash on Metro-North Railroad; report reveals agency has focused large amount of attention on Ellen Brody, driver of vehicle that was struck by train, but there remain many questions.
lead_paragraph: Documents released on Wednesday show that federal investigators have devoted considerable attention on the actions of a driver who was one of six people killed in the February collision.

headline.main: Metro-North Crash Inquiry Delves Into Behavior of Woman Killed on Tracks
headline.print_headline: Inquiry Into Metro-North Crash Scrutinizes Final Actions of Driver Killed on Tracks
